str2: Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ek and agorazo; to buy up, i.e. Ransom; figuratively, to rescue from loss.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Cursing; a curse; meton: a doomed one. From kata and ara; imprecation, execration.

From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.

str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
From epi and a derivative of kataraomai; imprecated, i.e. Execrable.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

str2: To hang, hang up, suspend; mid: To be hanging, hang. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to hang.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
From another form of the base of xestes; timber; by implication, a stick, club or tree or other wooden article or substance.
